message_1: What is the slope of the line passing through the points (-3, 4) and (5, -2)?
message_2:
To find the slope of the line passing through the points (-3, 4) and (5, -2), we can use the slope formula:

m = (y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1)

where m is the slope, (x1, y1) are the coordinates of the first point, and (x2, y2) are the coordinates of the second point.

Plugging in the given points:

m = (-2 - 4) / (5 - (-3))

m = (-6) / (8)

m = -3/4

The slope of the line passing through the points (-3, 4) and (5, -2) is -3/4.
